idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7600) ; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

descript.abstract: United States Census Block Centroid Populations is a point theme representing the populations of the 2010 U.S. Census blocks for United States. U.S. Census blocks are the smallest geographic entities within a county for which the Census Bureau tabulates population.. U.S. Census blocks nest within all other tabulated census geographic entities and are the basis for all tabulated data.
descript.purpose: U.S. Census Block Centroid Populations provides population and other demographic information for each U.S. Census block centroid within the United States.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:100,000.

citeinfo.title: United States Census Block Centroid Populations, 2012
citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau, Esri

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, you may contact Esri Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded.
Outside the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent the centroids of census blocks, the smallest entity for which the Census Bureau collects and tabulates decennial census information within the United States; bounded by visible features such as streets, streams, and railroad tracks, and by nonvisible boundaries such as selected property lines and city, township, school district, and county limits. Note: this data set doesn't include the centroids of census blocks that for example consist of water polygons, medians, access ramps, and land enclosures.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for the state in which the block is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (three-digit number) for the county in which the block is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The combined state and county FIPS code. County FIPS codes begin with 001 for each state, use the combined code (five-digit number) to uniquely identify a county.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The four-digit number, with a two-digit suffix, used to identify a census tract. Census tract numbers are always unique within a county and usually unique within a metropolitan area.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology
National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The Census code (four-digit number) for the block.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The combined state and county FIPS codes, and tract and block Census codes.
The total number of households in the block in 2010.
The total number of housing units in the block in 2010.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: Data & Maps is available only as part of Esri software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
citeinfo.title: Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File; Summary File 1 (SF 1)

serinfo.sername: Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File; Summary File 1 (SF 1)

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

citeinfo.othercit:
The geospatial data is calculated from the latitude and longitude coordinates from the 2010 Census Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File.
The Summary File 1 (SF 1) data is based on the 2010 Census of Population and Housing.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Created the block centroids from the 2010 Census Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File. Reordered and renamed the fields. Added fields STATE_FIPS, CNTY_FIPS, STCOFIPS, TRACT, and BLOCK and created their values from parsing the values of the FIPS field. Projected the data set to World Geodetic System of 1984 (WGS 1984). Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was calculated from latitude and longitude coordinates. The horizontal positional accuracy is unknown.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify, validate, and if needed repair the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
